title: How to Make Veggie and Melted Cheese Wraps

steps.headline: Heat olive oil over medium high heat in a frying pan.
Add zucchini and tomatoes.
steps.description: Sauté until they soften and zucchini has just a tinge of golden brown on the edges, about 3 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat and set aside.
Assemble the wrap: (See Roll a Burrito to learn more)
steps.description: Center cheese in tortilla. Add sautéed veggies and spinach on top. Tuck in the top and bottom corners of the tortilla, followed by the side corners until you've made a burrito-like pocket.

steps.headline: Wipe out the sauté pan with a paper towel and spray with a generous amount of cooking spray.
steps.description: Spray the seam side of the wrap as well.

steps.headline: Place the wrap in the pan, and cook for about 90 seconds, or until slightly brown.
Spray the top of the tortilla with cooking spray and flip.

text: Heat olive oil over medium high heat in a frying pan.  Add zucchini and tomatoes. Sauté until they soften and zucchini has just a tinge of golden brown on the edges, about 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside.  Assemble the wrap: (See Roll a Burrito to learn more) Center cheese in tortilla. Add sautéed veggies and spinach on top. Tuck in the top and bottom corners of the tortilla, followed by the side corners until you've made a burrito-like pocket. Wipe out the sauté pan with a paper towel and spray with a generous amount of cooking spray. Spray the seam side of the wrap as well. Place the wrap in the pan, and cook for about 90 seconds, or until slightly brown.  Spray the top of the tortilla with cooking spray and flip. Cook for another 90 seconds. Remove from heat and enjoy!
sentences: Heat olive oil over medium high heat in a frying pan.
Sauté until they soften and zucchini has just a tinge of golden brown on the edges, about 3 minutes.
Remove from the heat and set aside.
Assemble the wrap: (See Roll a Burrito to learn more) Center cheese in tortilla.
Add sautéed veggies and spinach on top.
Tuck in the top and bottom corners of the tortilla, followed by the side corners until you've made a burrito-like pocket.
Wipe out the sauté pan with a paper towel and spray with a generous amount of cooking spray.
Spray the seam side of the wrap as well.
Place the wrap in the pan, and cook for about 90 seconds, or until slightly brown.
Spray the top of the tortilla with cooking spray and flip.
